title: Teacher
body:
<<if visited("Teacher")>>
    Hello dearest robot.
<<else>>
    Hello.
<<endif>>
<<if $drama == 0>>
    [[Teacher.Drama0]]
<<endif>>
<<if $drama == 2>>
    [[Teacher.Drama2]]
<<endif>>
<<if $drama == 4>>
    [[Teacher.Drama4]]
<<endif>>
<<if $drama > 4>>
    [[Teacher.DramaFinished]]
<<endif>>
Have you heard of my daughter in the meantime?
She's the young lady in bright attire just south of here.

title: Teacher.Drama0
body:
You might have met my daughter,
she lives just south of here in a splendid house.
Point being that she should really visit school.
She is obviously not obliged to, but she never finished her education
and quite frankly, I am worried about her future.
What is supposed to become of her.
Could you go and talk to her about that?
She just will not listen to me anymore.
<<set $drama = 1>>

title: Teacher.Drama2
body:
How did my daughter respond?
-> She said she already has a good job.
    Yes... of course she did.
    What she does not understand is that good might not be enough
    We are a small community on this island.
    Every single resident has to provide a use so we can persist
    and sadly looking good just does not do that, does it?
    <<set $drama = 3>>

title: Teacher.Drama4
body:
Are there any news from my dearest daughter?
-> She says her job is just as valuable as yours. You should talk to her.
    Can you imagine how often I tried that.
    She would never listen to a single one of my rational claims.
    But now that I listened to what she is saying in your words...
    ...I realise I never listened to her either.
    I have to collect myself, then I will meet with her and listen.
    Something I should have done months ago.
    You truly rebuilt a bridge between us.
    Thank you so much.
    <<set $drama = 5>>

title: Teacher.DramaFinished
body:
Thank you for your help earlier.
But not I have to collect myself to see my daughter.
It's been way too long since we really talked.
You can probably imagine the awkwardness in this tiny village.
